title: Looking for a direction
content:
Working on a brand with a custom script. We have 2 directions and are trying to see which one to refine (then getting ideas on refinement directions is the next step). Curious what the Typophiles think...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317190709im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-02-26%20at%201_6400.13.58%20PM.png)

Which of these work best...

Brands attributes are things like choice, comfort, movement, urban, quality, vibrance, approachable. We've been staring at these so long, we need fresh eyes.
author: kamolahy

comments.content:
I like the second one except the "COFFEE COMPANY" needs to align on the left with the vertical stem of the /H. Then take a look at the right alignment of the line and move the last word to align with the right side of the /e.

If you can figure out a way to better space the "Hiline" to fix the erratic character spacing, that would be a big help too.
